error.signature: RuntimeError: This event loop is already running
error.regex: RuntimeError: This event loop is already running

verdict.summary: Calling asyncio.run() or loop.run_until_complete() when an event loop is already running (common in Jupyter/IPython).

dead_ends.action: Creating a new event loop with asyncio.new_event_loop()
dead_ends.why_fails: May cause resource leaks and conflicts with the existing loop

dead_ends.action: Using threading to run a separate event loop

workarounds.action: In Jupyter, use 'await coroutine()' directly (top-level await) instead of asyncio.run()
workarounds.how: Jupyter has its own running event loop; use it directly

workarounds.action: Use nest_asyncio.apply() to allow nested event loops
workarounds.how: import nest_asyncio; nest_asyncio.apply() â€” enables nested run_until_complete()

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'RuntimeError' indicates an asyncio event loop conflict, while 'TypeError' indicates an iteration attempt on a non-iterable object.
'RuntimeError' indicates an asyncio event loop conflict, while 'ValueError' indicates an invalid string-to-number conversion.
